Audigy2 does not do 24-bit audio in Linux.  Ripoff.
And PulseAudio refuses to do surround with it.
It inter/extrapolates 24-bit streams to/from 16 bit, just like Audigy 1
Linux is being honest with you, Windows isn't
The DSP in Audigy 1 and 2 is only 16 bit. When you feed it a 24 bit stream it has to up/downconvert it in order to be able to work with it
It is and Creative were successfully sued over it
The case wasn't in the US, it was the UK as I recall
